channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9204] An Offline SplitParent Region can be assigned breaking split references
item.description:
An offline split parent region can be assigned by using 'assign' from shell.

This may trigger a compaction on the split parent region that should be offline, breaking the references of the two daughters.

The easy way to test this is:

  • disable compactions
  • create a table and insert some row
  • split
  • shutdown the master (otherwise there's a state checked inside the AssignmentManager)
  • start the master
  • assign the region marked as OFFLINE => true, SPLIT => true (the compaction on region startup will probably break the reference of the two daughters)
item.summary: An Offline SplitParent Region can be assigned breaking split references

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: attached a simple patch that prevents the splitParent to be opened. This seems to do the trick, but I think the assignment manager should prevent a splitParent to be assigned.

Correct me if am wrong. If i remember correctly this scenario would be handled in master restart.


// Fixing up missing daughters if any

    status.setStatus("Fixing up missing daughters");

    fixupDaughters(status);

I need to accept that its long since i worked on issues in this area. But I had a feel that this piece of code would handle it. May be something changed in recent code?
I agree that AM should handle this and not the RegionServer.

ramkrishna.s.vasudevan I don't think is the same, that seems just to add missing daughters to META (but I have to check the code)

anyway that is not related to that problem, since in this case your daughters are now broken and a region balance or move will trigger an exception on region startup, since the referenced files are missing.


parent/file-after-compaction

daughter-1/missing-file.parent

daughter-2/missing-file.parent

In HBASE-9052, we enhanced AM a little to make split parent not assignable if master is not restarted. I think we can do the same in this case.
I can post a patch: put such regions (if any) in split state so that they won't be able to assign from master.

ramkrishna.s.vasudevan, the code you referred to have been removed from trunk since meta update is an atomic operation now (row mutations). During master failover, the region should be ignored since it is a split parent. However, manual assign is not blocked. That's why I propose to put the region in split state when master starts/restarts, so that it won't be allowed to assign.

I went thro the patch in HBASE-9052. +1 on doing the same here.
So on seeing that the region is offline and split we will set the state to SPLIT for such regions?

So on seeing that the region is offline and split we will set the state to SPLIT for such regions?

Yes. So it is about the same as we did in HBASE-9052.
So in 0.94 what could be done? I mean by the master itself on restart.
That's a great question. For now, I am not sure. Using Matteo's trick?

// If region is in offline and split state check the ZKNode

        if (regionInfo.isOffline() && regionInfo.isSplit()) {

          String node = ZKAssign.getNodeName(this.watcher, regionInfo

              .getEncodedName());

          Stat stat = new Stat();

          byte[] data = ZKUtil.getDataNoWatch(this.watcher, node, stat);

          // If znode does not exist, don't consider this region

          if (data == null) {

            LOG.debug("Region "	+  regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString()

               + " split is completed. Hence need not add to regions list");

            continue;

          }

        }

We are doing something here. But i think the problem is the znode is available and hence we still try to assign it? Need to check the code once again. The above code is there in both code base trunk and 0.94.
In trunk, we can simply put the region in split state before the continue.
Should I delay 0.94.11 for this? Or just put Matteo's fix there?

With Matteo's fix, the region will be stuck in transition (0.94) or moved to FAILED_OPEN state (trunk). It's better to do something in AM, for example, ignore an assignment request if the region is a split parent, which is ugly, but works.
Attached a patch for 0.94: skip assigning split parent; a patch for trunk: move split parent to SPLIT state so that it won't be assigned.
Jimmy Xiang, did you attach the wrong file for 0.94? It just has Matteo's change plus some unrelated change from another jira.
Oh wait, your change now is in AssignmentManager. The short operation stuff is another jira, though.

I'm +1 on the 94 patch without the rpc timeout stuff,
not sure about the trunk one. It looks like that the fix is only on master restart
what about regions assigned on clone or regions assigned after an hbck -fixMeta (which should be the same as clone)
Wrong 0.94 patch. Fixed it.

what about regions assigned on clone or regions assigned after an hbck -fixMeta (which should be the same as clone)

Good point. I can add another check. During restore/clone a table, when will the table is enabled/created?
Lemme clone the issue for 0.94. Would like to cut an 0.94.11RC today.
Created HBASE-9207.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12597801/0.94-9204.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6726//console

This message is automatically generated.

Good point. I can add another check. During restore/clone a table, when will the table is enabled/created?

clone and restore follow the same CreateTable code, with the difference that in this case the list of HRegionInfo passed to the assignmentManager.assign() may contain some offline split parent, so there're no znodes or other states around.
Let me think about the side effects of patch v2.

Attached v3: added some test changes to test this issue, fixed the split parent handling during recovery and creating table (clone). Basically, similar to HBASE-9052, we put split parent to SPLIT state so that it won't be assigned by mistake.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12598014/trunk-9204_v3.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

I skimmed and patch looks reasonable to me. We are adding coverage for obvious holes. I'd be good w/ this going in. What says Matteo Bertozzi?
+1, v3.1 looks good to me
Integrated into trunk and 0.96. Thanks everyone.
